identificationModule.officialTitle: Peripheral Perfusion Index as Marker for Systemic Hemodynamics During Anesthesia

descriptionModule.briefSummary: In patients under general anesthesia the investigators wish to investigate association and covariance between a peripheral perfusion index as obtained by Radical 7 monitor (Masimo, Irvine, CA, USA) and more traditional hemodynamic parameters, ie. invasive blood pressure and SV as obtained by LiDCO rapid monitor (LiDCO Ldt., London, UK)

primaryOutcomes.measure: Co-variance between Perfusion Index (PI) and Cardiac Output (CO) and Stroke Volume (SV)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Co-variance between Perfusion Index (PI) and Mean Arterial Pressure (MAP)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Patients for elective and sub-acute surgical repair of para-oesophagal hernia.
* Willingness to participate

Exclusion Criteria:

* Patient refusal
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Patients for elective and sub-acute surgical repair of para-oesophagal hernia.
